metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7426 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
NTP before 4.2.8p9 rate limits responses received from the configured sources when rate limiting for all associations is enabled, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (prevent responses from the sources) by sending responses with a spoofed source address.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7426` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.5
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> "Affects ntp-4.2.5p203, up to but not including ntp-4.2.8p9, and ntp-4.3.0 up to, but not including ntp-4.3.94."

criterions.comment: ntp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.5').
